thread.title: Girl uses 'Office' quotes on Tinder, convinces boy she's a beet farmer
thread.title_full: Girl uses 'Office' quotes on Tinder, convinces boy she's a beet farmer

author: Mike Moffitt
title: Girl uses 'Office' quotes on Tinder, convinces boy she's a beet farmer

persons.name: angus t. jones  angus t. jones

text:
By Mike Moffitt Updated 1:02 pm, Tuesday, January 17, 2017 yesterday i convinced a boy that i am a beet farmer by using quotes from the office pic.twitter.com/3xzSEJGVfz â€” caroline (@caro_bearo) January 15, 2017 
Can a woman with a love for beets find her soulmate on Tinder? 
A Kent State University freshman named Caroline decided to have a little fun with the matchmaking app by using only quotes from "The Office" to converse with a boy. 
Specifically, she used lines from the Dwight Schrute character, who during one episode, describes his beet-farming background. 
Caroline told her match, named Nate, that she inherited a 60-acre beet farm from her grandfather and that she runs it with her cousin Mose. She shared a secret of roadside beet marketing: 
"First rule in roadside beet sales, put the most attractive beets on top. The ones that make you pull the car over and go, 'Wow, I need this beet right now.'" 
"That's cool," Nate responded. 
She also revealed that "I have seen animals having sex in every position imaginable. Goat on chicken. Chicken on goat... 
"Thats awesome," said Nate. 
After her tweet went viral, Caroline told Nate about the prank. He was a good sport, she said. 
"He thought it was hilarious and that it was cool that it was getting so many retweets," she said. Video: Rainn Wilson of The Office Parodies Angus T. Jones 
Angus T. Jones of "Two and a Half Men" recently released a video bashing the show that made him famous, and Rainn Wilson did a parody, as a way to promote the final season of "The Office." Gillian Pensavalle has the comparison. Media: San Francisco Chronicle
